string.description: Text shown on bottom of QR code capture activity to indicate SKIP button presence. [CHAR_LIMIT=30]
string.name: cannot_find_symbol

string.description: Text shown when a connection error occurs when retrieving the QR Code content. [CHAR_LIMIT=30]
string.name: connection_error

string.description: Text shown when an invalid QR code is scanned. [CHAR_LIMIT=30]
string.name: invalid_qr_code

string.description: Text shown when dependencies are not available to scan QR Codes. [CHAR_LIMIT=40]
string.name: missing_dependencies

string.description: Text shown on Android Toast when camera permission is not granted. [CHAR_LIMIT=70]
string.name: no_camera_permission

resources.string: Camera permission is not granted and is needed to read QR codes

string.description: Text shown on Android Toast when permissions are not granted. [CHAR_LIMIT=140]
string.name: no_permissions

resources.string: Cardboard SDK requires camera and write to external storage permission to read the QR code and save the encoded device parameters.

string.description: Text shown on bottom of QR code capture activity to indicate instructions to read QR code. [CHAR_LIMIT=50]
string.name: reading_qr_code_instructions

resources.string: Find this Cardboard symbol on your viewer

string.description: Text shown for button to skip the workflow to pair a Cardboard view with the user's phone. [CHAR_LIMIT=10]
string.name: skip_scanning

string.description: Text shown when a device with NFC tag is detected [CHAR_LIMIT=30]
string.name: viewer_detected
